lead_paragraph: Before he died, Bill Cornwell bequeathed his West Village brownstone to his longtime partner Tom Doyle. But the will was invalid, and now Mr. Doyle is fighting with Mr. Cornwell’s nieces and nephews over who should inherit the multimillion dollar property.

headline.print_headline: A Bitter Fight Over Who Inherits a Village Brownstone
headline.main: A Brownstone and the Bitter Fight to Inherit It

snippet: Before he died, Bill Cornwell bequeathed his West Village brownstone to his longtime partner Tom Doyle. But the will was invalid, and now Mr. Doyle is fighting with Mr. Cornwell’s nieces and nephews over who should inherit the multimillion dolla...
abstract: Greenwich Village resident Tom Doyle sues nieces and nephews of his life partner Bill Cornwell over ownership of brownstone two men shared for more than 50 years; men were never legally married and will in which Cornwell left building to Doyle was found to be technically invalid; heirs deny their uncle actually intended to make bequest and are selling property.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
